tags.name: auth
tags.description: Authentication: logging in and out of Hive

tags.name: devices
tags.description: Get and manage devices on the Swarm network

post.description: Updates the password for the current user given their old password.

get.description: Get a JSON of the account info for the current user.

post.description: Update, via JSON, the account info for the current user.

get.description:
This endpoint requests a JSON formatted array of messages which are filtered by the parameters. Only returns messages from the last 30 days.
Note: If a packetid is specified, all other filters will be ignored, and the message with that packetid will always be returned unless it's more than 30 days old.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Numeric Organization ID.

parameters.name: userApplicationId
parameters.description: Numeric User Application ID.

parameters.name: devicetype
parameters.description: Numeric Swarm device type.

parameters.name: deviceid
parameters.description: Numeric Swarm device ID.

parameters.name: devicename
parameters.description: Swarm device name. Deprecated and no longer used to filter messages. Use devicetype and deviceid instead.

parameters.name: viadeviceid
parameters.description: Numeric Swarm firsthop groundstation device ID. Use -1 for last known nexthop for this device.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Result count requested. Default is 100. Max is 1000.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Numeric filter for message status. Use value of 0 for unacknowledged (not yet processed by user), 2 for acknowledged. Default is 0. Optional.

parameters.name: beforepacketid
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Pass the last packet ID from the previous page. Optional.

parameters.name: packetid
parameters.description: Numeric filter for packet ID.  Returns single message matching packet ID. Optional.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Filter for direction of travel.  Use "fromdevice" for messages received from Swarm devices, "todevice" for messages sent to Swarm devices, "all" for both. Default is "fromdevice". Optional.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date filter as UTC ISO 8601. Must be within the last 30 days. Optional.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date filter as UTC ISO 8601. Must be within the last 30 days. Must be after startDate. Optional.

post.description:
This endpoint submits a JSON formatted UserMessage object for delivery to a Swarm device. A JSON object is returned with a newly assigned packetId and status ofOK on success, or ERROR (with a description of the error) on failure.

The current user must have access to the userApplicationId and device given inside the UserMessage JSON. The device must also have the ability to receive messages from the Hive ("two-way communication") enabled. If these conditions are not met, a response with status code 403 (Forbidden) will be returned.

Note that the data field is the Base64-encoded version of the data to be sent. This allows the sending of binary, as well as text, data.

post.summary: Acknowledge receipt of a user message.
post.description: This endpoint acknowledges receipt of a user message. Path variable {packetId} is required. A JSON object is returned with the new "packetId" and "status" of "OK" for success or "ERROR" for failure.

parameters.name: packetId
parameters.description: Numeric packet ID. Required.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Set numeric message status. Use value of 0 for received, 2 for acknowledged. Default is 2. Optional.

post.description: Register a field device using its auth code. Returns the registered device.
Deregister a field device using its auth code or ID.
Deprecated: use POST /hive/api/v1/devices/deregister instead. Deregister a field device using its auth code or ID.
Deprecated: use POST /hive/api/v1/devices/register instead. Register a field device using its auth code. Returns the registered device.

patch.description: Edit an organization. Only the provided properties will be changed.

get.description: Get a the user context for the current user.
Get a JSON array of rfPacketTelemetry matching the given parameters.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Numeric Organization ID.

parameters.name: srcDeviceType
parameters.description: Filters to telemetry from devices of this type. Required.

parameters.name: srcDeviceId
parameters.description: Filters to telemetry from devices of this id. Required.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Filters to telemetry at a time at or after (>=) startTime (ISO 8601 format, UTC time zone). Optional.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Filters to telemetry at a time strictly before (<) endTime (ISO 8601 format, UTC time zone). Optional.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Return at most <count> telemetries. Default value 100. Max value 500. Optional.

parameters.name: sortAsc
parameters.description: True to sort ascending by telemetryAt, false to sort descending. False by default. Optional.

get.description: Get a JSON array of rfPacketTelemetry matching the given parameters.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Numeric Organization ID.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Filters to telemetry at a time at or after (>=) startTime (ISO 8601 format, UTC time zone). Optional.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Filters to telemetry at a time strictly before (<) endTime (ISO 8601 format, UTC time zone). Optional.

get.summary: Acknowledge receipt of UserMessage via GET.
get.description: This endpoint acknowledges receipt of a user application message (UserMessage).  Path variables {userApplicationId} and {packetId} are required. A JSON object is returned with the new "packetId" and "status" of "OK" for success or "ERROR" for failure.

parameters.name: userApplicationId
parameters.description: Numeric User Application ID. Ignored.

parameters.name: packetId
parameters.description: Numeric packet ID.  Required.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Set numeric message status.  Use value of 0 for received, 2 for acknowledged. Default is 2. Optional

get.summary: GET user messages by organization ID
get.description: This endpoint requests a JSON formatted array of messages which are filtered by the parameters. Only returns messages from the last 30 days.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Provided for backwards compatibility with application ID

parameters.name: userApplicationId
parameters.description: Numeric User Application ID.

parameters.name: devicetype
parameters.description: Numeric Swarm device type.

parameters.name: deviceid
parameters.description: Numeric Swarm device ID.

parameters.name: devicename
parameters.description: Swarm device name. Deprecated and no longer used to filter messages. Use devicetype and deviceid instead.

parameters.name: viadeviceid
parameters.description: Numeric Swarm firsthop groundstation device ID. Use -1 for last known nexthop for this device.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Result count requested. Default is 100. Max is 1000.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Numeric filter for message status. Use value of 0 for unacknowledged (not yet processed by user), 2 for acknowledged. Default is 0. Optional.

parameters.name: beforepacketid
parameters.description: Used for pagination. Pass the last packet ID from the previous page. Optional.

parameters.name: packetid
parameters.description: Numeric filter for packet ID.  Returns single message matching packet ID. Optional.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Filter for direction of travel.  Use "fromdevice" for messages received from Swarm devices or "todevice" for messages sent to Swarm devices. Default is "fromdevice". Optional.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date filter as UTC ISO 8601. Optional.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date filter as UTC ISO 8601. Must be after startDate. Optional.

get.summary: GET user message by message id
get.description: This endpoint requests details, including retry attempts, for a message with the given message id. Only returns messages that have been sent in the last 30 days,though previous attempts to send the message from before 30 days ago may be included.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message ID to get details for.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Organization ID. Optional.

get.summary: GET total count of messages sent through the network by the current user.
get.description: Gets the count of messages associated with userApplicationIds. Counts messages both received (from edge devices) and sent (to edge devices) through the Swarm network. Ignores messages marked as duplicate messages.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Filters to messages which are received by the Hive at a time at or after (>=) startTime (ISO 8601 format, UTC time zone). Optional, default is all available data.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Filters to messages which are received by the Hive at a time strictly before (<) endTime (ISO 8601 format, UTC time zone). Optional, default is all available data.

parameters.name: deviceType
parameters.description: This parameter is deprecated and will be ignored if present.

get.description:
Get a JSON array of devices visible to the user, filtered by the parameters.

Recommended use cases:

  • Get all user devices
  • Get by devicetype
  • Get by devicetype and deviceid
  • Get by devicename
  • Get by deviceuuid

    • Note that getting by multiple fields will try to filter by all of those fields. For example, trying to get by devicetype + devicename could return no results if the device with the given name doesn't have the given type.

parameters.name: sortDesc
parameters.description: Sort descending by device id if true; sort ascending otherwise. False by default.

get.description: Get a plaintext string of the number of devices visible to the user, filtered by the parameters.

post.description:
Use username and password to log in.

On success: returns status code 200. The response body is the JSON {"token": "<token>"}, along with the header Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=<token>; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly;. The tokens in the return value and the Set-Cookie header are the same. The token is a long string of letters, numbers, and punctuation.

On failure: returns status code 401.

To make authenticated requests, there are two ways:

  • (Preferred) Use the token as a Bearer Authentication token by including the HTTP header Authorization: Bearer <token> in further requests.
  • (Deprecated) Use the token as the JSESSIONID cookie in further requests.

Set-Cookie.description:
Session cookie to use for authenticating further requests.

NOTE: When using "try it out" on the API documentation page, this header will be omitted from the response headers due to browser security restrictions: see the Set-Cookie documentation for more details.

In lieu of looking at this header value during testing, simply use the returned token in the response body.

get.description:
Log out of the current session.

If user is not logged in (with a valid Bearer authentication token or JSESSIONID cookie), returns 401.

On success, returns 204 (No Content).

deviceName.description: Device name. By default, looks like F-0x00010 for deviceType = 1 and deviceId = 16

messageId.description: Swarm message ID. There may be multiple messages for a single message ID. A message ID represents an intent to send a message, but there may be multiple Swarm packets that are required to fulfill that intent. For example, if a Hive -> device message fails to reach its destination, automatic retry attempts to send that message will have the same message ID.

len.description: Length of data (in bytes) before base64 encoding

ackPacketId.description: Swarm packet ID of acknowledging packet from device

status.description:
Message status. Possible values:
0 = incoming message (from a device)
1 = outgoing message (to a device)
2 = incoming message, acknowledged as seen by customer. OR a outgoing message packet is on groundstation
3 = outgoing message, packet is on satellite
-1 = error
-3 = failed to deliver, retrying
-4 = failed to deliver, will not re-attempt

hiveRxTime.description: Time that the message was received by the Hive

status.description: Submission status, "OK" or "ERROR" with a description of the error.

deviceType.description: 3 bit device type. 1 = fieldBee, 2 = stratoBee, 3 = spaceBee, 4 = groundBee, 5 = Hive

deviceName.description: Device name. By default, looks like F-0x00010 for deviceType = 1 and deviceId = 16

organizationId.description: Organization id the device belongs to

lastTelemetryReportPacketId.description: Packet id of last telemetry report from device

twoWayEnabled.description: Whether or not this device can receive return messages from the hive. Only applies to field devices.

dataEncryptionEnabled.description: Whether messages to/from this device are encrypted.

fromDeviceMessageCount.description: Total messages sent from a device to the hive

toDeviceMessageCount.description: Total messages sent from the hive to a device

fromDeviceMessageCount.description: Total messages sent from a device to the hive

toDeviceMessageCount.description: Total messages sent from the hive to a device
